data.title: jni-gen, Add $compilerSuffix property
data.body:
Very simple change that shouldn't interfere with the build process (please double check), but allows me to do:

```
ant -DcompilerSuffix=.exe -DndkSuffix=.cmd
// or (how I use it):
ant -f build-windows64.xml -DcompilerSuffix=.exe
ant -f build-android32.xml -DndkSuffix=.cmd
```

Without modifying the build files everytime.

data.title: Added Vector.limit(float maxLength) methods
data.body: It's useful if you want to limit the vector to certain length.

data.title: Have to set the coordinates before you can transform them
data.body:
I found this while looking closely at uses of temporary variables in scene2d.  I'm not exactly sure what was broken before, but I'm pretty confident this fixes it.

I ran the UITest and ShadowMappingTest, and both seem to work fine.  I wonder if they mostly worked before because the Vector2.tmp generally already had relatively similar screen coordinates in it?

data.title: Added Vector.limit(float maxLength) methods
data.body: It's useful if you want to limit the vector to certain length.

data.title: Don't allow simultaneous drags in DragAndDrop class
data.body:
The DragAndDrop class only manages one payload and drag actor, so we
need to stop several drag events from happening at the same time.

I have several DragAndDrop.Source objects managed by the DragAndDrop class, when I'm trying to drag two Source objects simultaneously the drag actor and payload isn't handled correctly (since you can only have one payload/drag actor in DragAndDrop).

My workaround is to make sure only one drag is recognized at a time. Not sure if this is how it should be solved though.

data.title: Add isCurrent() method to LwjglAWTCanvas.
data.body: ...ainly useful for cases where you have multiple canvas contexts, and you want to know if any of them are current before loading a resource that requires an active context.

data.title: Bullet, seperate render and update, add CollisionTest
data.body: Adds a (dynamics) collision test.

data.title: Ios socket exception bugfix
data.body:
While creating a network socket when there is not network, IOS Socket exception is thrown by the Mono framework. However, this is not caught by Java Exception.
Couple of lines of code added to catch the Mono exception and to keep the Java compiler happy.

data.title: Add 'includeantruntime="false"' to javac
data.body:
Newer versions of ANT warn about the fact that the ANT runtime is
included on a javac compile.  Since this is not generally what is
wanted (but is backwards compatible with older versions of ANT), a new
flag
    includeantruntime="false"
will disable it.

This will clear up the Jenkins warnings like this:

```
[javac] /var/lib/jenkins/workspace/libgdx/build-template.xml:51: warning: 'includeantruntime' was not set, defaulting to build.sysclasspath=last; set to false for repeatable builds
```

AFAICT, this is backwards compatible with older versions of ANT.

(Let me know if you'd rather have small fixes like this batched up into a larger pull request,  or not.)

data.title: Improve generated javadoc and zipfile
data.body:
Add a better copyright notice to the footer of javadoc (include the
magical © symbol, and the current year 2013).

Add the user-visible bits of the iOS and GWT backends to the javadoc
construction.

Change the version number to "0.9.9-SNAPSHOT", as I believe this is
where libGDX is.

data.title: Making subclassing of Particle class feasible (by making fields protected)
data.body: subclass possible

data.title: GWT test cleanup
data.body:
Get gdx-tests-gwt compiling to JavaScript again.  I added some GWT stubs for NetApiTest, but ended up disabling it for now (I'm not sure how to fix its abuse of FileHandles).  Added some stubs to the GWT java.lang.Thread to actually implement the Uncaught Exception handler (so the RunnablePostTest will compile).

Cleaned up the index.html page, and made the test runner a bit more verbose (enabled the "console" too).

Let me know if you'd like me to try a different approach on any of the GWT stubs, or if anything looks like it needs a format pass.

data.title: Add Vector, Path, Bezier and BSpline
data.body:
Vector: an interface with common methods that both Vector2 and Vector3 implement for creating more general math classes. Only had to implement Vector2#mul(Vector2) for this, although it might be nice to also have #crs method.

Path: Simple general interface to seemlessly walk trough some path/process/whatever from 0 to 1. (perhaps there's already such a class i'm not aware of).

Bezier: Simple class to calculate first, second and third degree bezier curves which also implements Path. 

BSpline: Only cubic bsplines (not weighted) for now. If you like I can also modify catmulllromspline to implement Path (not sure if thats possible though, haven't checked the specifics of that implementation yet).

Bezier and BSpline shows the use of having a general Vector interface, it makes the following possible:

``` java
Path<Vector2> path2 = Bezier<Vector2>();
Path<Vector3> path3 = Bezier<Vector3>();
```

I also added a test to show the usage.

data.title: Allow RepeatAction to be finished
data.body:
The finish() method has no effect.
the private boolean finished is never used.

data.title: Add Predicate.
!F - Adds Polyline support to GleedMapLoader
data.body: Until now, I was treating every path item as a Polygon. Polylines are highly helpful to generate ChainShapes which makes static level collisions easy.

data.title: Bullet, Add managing child shapes for btCompoundShape
data.body:
See http://badlogicgames.com/forum/viewtopic.php?f=11&t=7679

Also added btCollisionObject#dispose.

data.title: Add getUIViewController() in IOSApplication
data.body: Needed to display the keyboard for IOS.

data.title: JogAmp 2.0.2 libGDX backend.
data.body:
For use with http://jogamp.org/deployment/archive/master/gluegen_629-joal_396-jogl_903-jocl_741-signed/ the JogAmp 2.0.2 pre-release.

This new JOGL 2 backend allows libgdx games to run on GNU/Linux systems such as Ubuntu Toshiba tegra 2 AC100, Ubuntu nexus 7 and Raspberry Pi and of course many more systems.

Yell if i should flush all jogl binarys from the repo according to the new libgdx ant build script instructions.

Forum thread inside the JogAmp community discussing the merge:
http://forum.jogamp.org/JOGL-2-0-OpenGL-OpenGL-ES-backend-for-LibGDX-tp4027689p4028159.html

data.title: Javadoc fixes for Math
data.body:
Make URLs into real links in generated javadoc.  Improve the wording on
a bunch of functions.  Add thread-safety warnings to a bunch (but not
yet all) methods that use Vector3.tmp().

data.title: Javadoc fixes for com.badlogic.gdx.files
data.body:
Add a note about how different some files are (compressed inside an
.apk for example).  Try out a "package-info.java" file for documenting
package-level ideas.  Replace @throw with @throws.

data.title: Update scene2d javadoc
data.body:
Add more text to class descriptions to give a bit of an overview of how
the pieces fit together (as far as I can tell).  Add an example.  Fix a 
bunch of minor typos and one javadoc warning.

data.body: on a side note: any idea how to get glTexSubImage to work on the GWT backend? Is this supposed to work? All I get is INVALID_VALUE. Works on all the other backends.
